result.name: income-support
result.notes: Income Support (IS) is a means tested benefit payable for people under Pension Credit age, working less than 16 hours per week, have no or little income and no more than £16000 in savings. The data is produced on a quarterly basis, and contains includes Name, National Insurance Number, Address, medical information, claim dates and payment history.

organization.name: department-for-work-and-pensions
organization.title: Department for Work and Pensions
organization.description:
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare and pension policy and is a key player in tackling child poverty. It is the biggest public service delivery department in the UK and serves over 20 million customers.

DWP is a ministerial department, supported by 13 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-work-pensions

result.title: Income Support

extras.value: https://www.gov.uk/income-support    Not due to be released. Contains personal and sensitive data. Will be reviewed in the light of demand and prioritisation.
